definitions: not processed into a pure or more concentrated state through removal of impurities
lacking sophistication, culture, or social polish in manner or taste
examples: The unrefined sugar retains more natural minerals
They started with unrefined crude oil from the wells
His unrefined manners embarrassed his sophisticated hosts
The restaurant's unrefined decor clashed with its fine cuisine

definitions: not entered in an official register or record; lacking official documentation or authorization
examples: The unregistered firearm was confiscated by police
Many unregistered voters were turned away from the polls

definitions: not controlled or governed by regulations, rules, or official oversight; operating without restrictions
examples: The unregulated market led to consumer exploitation
These unregulated substances pose serious health risks

definitions: having no connection, relationship, or relevance to something else; not connected by kinship
examples: These two unrelated incidents occurred on the same day
The witness discussed unrelated matters during testimony

definitions: not yet made available to the public; held back from distribution or publication
examples: The band's unreleased recordings surfaced years later
Several unreleased films remain in the studio vault

definitions: not yielding in strength, severity, or determination; maintaining intensity without pause or mercy
examples: The unrelenting rain flooded the entire region
She faced unrelenting criticism from the media

definitions: not able to be relied upon; inconsistent in quality or performance; likely to fail
examples: The unreliable narrator confused readers throughout the novel
Their unreliable internet connection disrupted the meeting

definitions: not particularly interesting or surprising; ordinary and not deserving special notice
examples: The restaurant served unremarkable food at premium prices
Her unremarkable appearance helped her blend into crowds

definitions: showing no regret for one's wrongdoings; refusing to acknowledge guilt or express remorse
examples: The unrepentant criminal showed no emotion during sentencing
She remained unrepentant about her controversial decision

definitions: not reported to authorities or media; not made known through official channels
examples: Many unreported crimes never appear in statistics
The unreported income triggered an audit

definitions: not returned or reciprocated, especially referring to love or feelings not mutual
examples: His unrequited love for her lasted many years
The poem explored themes of unrequited passion

definitions: not reserved or restricted; available for general use without limitations
frank and open in manner; expressing feelings or opinions without holding back
examples: The theater offers unreserved seating for this performance
All unreserved parking spaces filled up quickly
She gave her unreserved support to the proposal
His unreserved enthusiasm impressed the interview panel

definitions: not resolved or settled; remaining without a solution or definite conclusion
examples: Several unresolved issues delayed the contract signing
The unresolved conflict continues to affect their relationship

definitions: not reacting or responding to stimuli, communication, or treatment; showing no response
examples: The unresponsive patient required immediate medical attention
Customer service remained unresponsive to our complaints

definitions: not restrained or restricted in action, expression, or behavior; lacking self-control
examples: Their unrestrained laughter filled the entire room
The critic's unrestrained praise surprised everyone

definitions: not limited or restricted; free from constraints or limitations on use or access
examples: Members enjoy unrestricted access to all facilities
The company granted unrestricted rights to the patent

definitions: not ripe; not yet ready for harvesting or eating due to incomplete development
examples: The unripe bananas will ripen in several days
Eating unripe fruit can cause stomach discomfort

definitions: having no rival or equal; superior to all others in quality or performance
examples: Her unrivaled expertise made her the obvious choice
The company's unrivaled reputation attracts top talent

definitions: disorderly and disruptive; difficult to control or manage due to lack of discipline
examples: The teacher struggled with several unruly students
Her unruly hair refused to stay in place

definitions: not safe; involving or exposing one to risk, danger, or harm
examples: The building was declared unsafe after the earthquake
Driving in these conditions is extremely unsafe

definitions: not officially approved, authorized, or permitted by proper authorities
examples: The unsanctioned protest led to multiple arrests
Players faced penalties for unsanctioned tournament participation

definitions: not sanitary; so unclean as to be a threat to health; lacking proper hygiene
examples: The restaurant closed due to unsanitary kitchen conditions
Workers complained about unsanitary bathroom facilities

definitions: not satisfactory; not good enough to meet standards or fulfill requirements
examples: The student received unsatisfactory grades this semester
Management found his explanation completely unsatisfactory

definitions: not satisfied; feeling that something is inadequate or that desires remain unfulfilled
examples: Customers remained unsatisfied with the company's response
She felt unsatisfied despite achieving her goals

definitions: not giving satisfaction or fulfillment; failing to meet expectations or desires
examples: The movie's unsatisfying ending disappointed many viewers
He found his career increasingly unsatisfying

definitions: disagreeable to taste or smell; unpleasant or distasteful
morally offensive; disreputable or questionable in character
examples: The unsavory smell emanated from the garbage bin
We avoided the unsavory dish at the buffet
His unsavory reputation preceded him everywhere
The investigation revealed unsavory business practices

definitions: without suffering any injury, damage, or harm despite dangerous circumstances
examples: She emerged unscathed from the car accident
The company survived the recession relatively unscathed

definitions: not scheduled or planned; occurring without being arranged beforehand
examples: The plane made an unscheduled stop in Chicago
An unscheduled meeting disrupted everyone's afternoon

definitions: not conforming to the principles or methods of science; lacking scientific rigor
examples: Critics dismissed the study as unscientific
Their unscientific approach yielded unreliable results

definitions: said or done without a prepared script; spontaneous and unrehearsed
examples: The actor's unscripted comment surprised the audience
They prefer unscripted reality shows

definitions: having or showing no moral principles; not honest or fair in business or personal dealings
examples: The unscrupulous landlord exploited vulnerable tenants
Unscrupulous companies take advantage of desperate workers

definitions: not sealed; having the seal broken or removed; open to access
examples: The unsealed envelope had clearly been tampered with
Unsealed court documents revealed new evidence

definitions: not secured or protected; lacking collateral or safety measures; vulnerable to risk
examples: The unsecured loan carried higher interest rates
Hackers exploited unsecured wireless networks

definitions: not seen or perceived; invisible or unnoticed by observers
examples: An unseen force seemed to guide their decisions
The damage remained unseen until the inspection

definitions: willing to put the needs or wishes of others before one's own; generous and altruistic
examples: Her unselfish dedication inspired the entire team
The volunteers showed unselfish commitment to the cause

definitions: not yet resolved or decided; remaining uncertain or undetermined
lacking stability or calmness; disturbed, anxious, or changeable in condition
examples: Several unsettled disputes delayed the merger
The unsettled lawsuit continues after three years
She felt unsettled by the strange phone call
The unsettled weather made planning difficult

definitions: unpleasant or unattractive to look at; visually offensive or disagreeable
examples: The unsightly graffiti ruined the building's appearance
She covered the unsightly scar with makeup

definitions: not signed; lacking an authorizing signature or official endorsement
examples: The unsigned contract has no legal validity
Several unsigned paintings were discovered in the attic

definitions: not having or requiring special skill or training; lacking expertise or qualification
examples: Unskilled workers often earn minimum wage
The job requires only unskilled manual labor

definitions: not sold; remaining in inventory without having been purchased
examples: The unsold inventory required deep discounts
Many unsold tickets were available on game day

definitions: not asked for or requested; given or offered without being sought
examples: She received unsolicited advice from strangers
The company sends unsolicited emails to thousands

definitions: not solved or explained; remaining without a solution or answer
examples: The unsolved murder haunted the detective for years
Several unsolved mysteries remain from ancient times

definitions: lacking worldly experience, refinement, or complexity in understanding
not complicated or advanced in design, technology, or method; simple or basic
examples: The unsophisticated tourists fell for every scam
His unsophisticated palate preferred simple foods
The device uses unsophisticated technology from decades ago
Their unsophisticated approach yielded surprising results

definitions: not solid or stable in structure; likely to collapse or fail physically
not based on valid reasoning or good judgment; flawed in logic or principle
examples: The unsound bridge was closed to traffic
Inspectors found unsound foundations in the building
His unsound reasoning led to poor decisions
The court rejected the unsound legal argument

definitions: too bad, horrific, or shocking to be expressed in words; beyond description
examples: They endured unspeakable horrors during the war
The accident caused unspeakable grief to the family

definitions: not stated, identified, or specified explicitly; left vague or undetermined
examples: The contract mentioned unspecified damages for breach
He left for an unspecified period of time

definitions: not spectacular or impressive; ordinary and failing to attract attention
examples: The team's unspectacular performance disappointed fans
He led an unspectacular but comfortable life

definitions: not spoiled, ruined, or corrupted; remaining in original or pristine condition
examples: The island remains unspoiled by tourism
Her unspoiled enthusiasm charmed everyone she met

definitions: not spoken or expressed aloud; understood or implied without being stated
examples: An unspoken agreement existed between the partners
Their unspoken feelings created tension in the room

definitions: not exhibiting sportsmanship; unfair, unethical, or ungracious in competitive behavior
examples: The referee penalized him for unsportsmanlike conduct
Her unsportsmanlike behavior angered opposing players
